txt.en:
'These Orcs know nothing of retreat - they will throw themselves at our feet until finally we wither and fall.

'To the west, Fastred employs a far more terrifying tactic - he makes of our enemies' heads grim standards that litter the ground as reminders to his foes that he is not to be crossed.

'Whether the Orcs pay this any heed, I know not. However, I know that Snowbourn stands still, and Walstow enters its fleeting throes. I would have us employ this strategy in Walstow... as gruesome as it is.

'Travel to the Orc camps of Ash Durub and Ufum-mau to the west and south-west of Walstow - take a trophy of each Orc's head, and steal their spears. Upon your return, we will mount them about town.'

'While such a vicious show of force is not normally my favoured choice, if we are to survive, I feel nothing can be lost by imitating Fastred.

'His thirst for destruction has made an impression on the Orcs and if they could feel such a thing as fear when approaching Snowbourn, I am certain they would.

'I will have these mounted about town. Thank you for honouring such a barbaric task with your aid.'
Winsig wants you to aid her in creating grim standards for Walstow. At Fastred's command, Orc heads shall only occupy one location in the Sutcrofts - the tip of a pike.
Beheaded Orcs in the south camp ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Collected spears from Orcs in Ash Durub or Ufum-mau ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Behead Orcs in the south camp ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Orcs and their heads can be found in the camps of Ufum-mau and Ash Durub, located to the south-west and west of Walstow, respectively.
Collect spears from Orcs in Ash Durub or Ufum-mau ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Winsig can be found in the Mead Hall of Walstow.
